ratings.comment:
Pop quizzes were common. 8am class, he would be very upset at people who were late and started locking the door at 8:00. Lectures were good enough.


I got the impression over the whole semester that he isn't very understanding of his students. I didn't particularly enjoy his class or my interactions with him.
Terrible in lecture and did not cover homework content. Final exam was extremely hard.

I wanted to like this professor, but I can't recommend him. Despite 10+ years of teaching, his course lacked consistency, with uneven content across sections. Exams were poorly balanced—an easy second test inflated grades, followed by a harsh final that felt more like an English exam. These issues shouldn't happen at this level.

I had this 8:00am MW and the second lecture he started yelling at the people walking in 1-5mins late. Scary!! He locked the door at 8 after that. Anyway, I thought his lectures were good and he had nicely typed up notes most of the year. Once I only turned in 1 page of a 10 page hw and despite having timestamped photos he didn't take it :(
don't take this if u don't have to. worst class i have ever been in.

Changing textbooks halfway through the course was kind of annoying but lectures were pretty decent and fair to learn from, he seems like a pretty nice guy but sometimes did weird things like lock the lecture room door at start time for class. Better than a lot of other stats professors though so take him if you get the chance.

Mr Bloss changed his lecture material halfway through the semester. He went from using nicely typed up notes in PDFs to just posting huge bunches of slides from the textbook which were annoying. Lots of homework each week and gave only two attempts on webassign before you got 0 points. Boring lectures. 1 extra credit opportunity. Hard exams.

Dr. Bloss seems like a nice guy. Didn't love having to code but it wasn't TOO hard to learn. The final was pretty rough even with three note pages. 25% for each exam (2 midterms, 1 final). Inconsistent teaching style. Skipped disscussion after the 1st. I just don't love the subject so the lectures were pretty boring. LOTS of homework some weeks

Lectures were slow moving so sometimes hard to pay attention but he's very passionate about teaching. First and second test was easy but the final was a lot harder. Homework was challenging at times and lots of points would be taken off for small things like rounding. Overall good class but challenging.

He was experimenting a lot with his lecture style and format considering it was his first year, so he was a little meandering and unclear in lecture. Very accessible outside of class as well. Exams were challenging (doesn't give practice exams) but if you pay attention in the lectures and take the time to find additional practice, you'll be fine.

Dr. Bloss was a very sweet and genuine guy, but sometimes I felt like the lectures were very disorganized. The lecture material was no where near the difficulty as the homework was. Some of the exams were very difficult given that we didn't have much material to utilize while studying.

The homework & quizzes are hard, they make up most of your grade, and Dr. Bloss's policy of -10% per hour late probably cost me at least a letter grade. But his lectures are peak and he understands better than any other stat or math professor I've had how to use & teach R coding and how to make stats practical for life science students.

I thought he was a great professor. I felt he really explained things well in lecture and the exams were pretty easy if you understood the lectures and the homework. He is a bit quirky and will get annoyed easily but other than that I thought he teaches much better than the average professor and actually wants to see all the students do well.
First exam was super hard. Seems like a nice guy though. Final isn't weighted more than midterms.

He was very inconsistent in his method of lecturing. At first, he started with slides and then at the end of the semester, he started just writing on random textbook pages that we did not have access to. His lectures were very unengaging and difficult to follow along with. We are not given any material to prepare for the exams.

There is very little material to study with and the lectures are really confusing, he switches between different media throughout the semester (like an ipad, slide shows, black boards, etc) and it is hard to follow. Not much help on Canvas either.
Bloss was great! the class is very test heavy but he is very accesable outside of class and understanding. Exams are very fair and he gives a full sheet of paper that can by typed for exams.
